call_title: A Better Proof of Work Fork Choice Rule | Dionysis Zindros | Ergoversary Summit 2024

topics.title: Introduction to POEM Paper and Research
topics.summary: Dionysis introduces the POEM (Proofs of Entropy Minima) paper co-authored with researchers from multiple institutions. The paper presents a new proof-of-work protocol that improves upon existing systems like Bitcoin and Ergo.

topics.title: Bitcoin's Proof of Work Inequality Explained
topics.summary: Detailed explanation of how Bitcoin's proof-of-work system works, including the hash function inequality, target difficulty, and how blocks are validated. Covers the relationship between mining power, target adjustment, and difficulty.

topics.title: Fork Choice Rules and Chain Scoring
topics.summary: Explains how blockchain networks handle forks and choose the canonical chain using scoring functions. Describes the heaviest chain rule and longest chain rule used in Bitcoin and Ergo, assuming constant difficulty for analysis simplicity.

topics.title: POEM's Entropic Scoring Method
topics.summary: Introduces POEM's core innovation: scoring blocks based on their actual hash values rather than nominal difficulty. Uses logarithmic scoring to count leading zeros, creating a continuous analog to NIPoPoWs superblocks where blocks with more zeros contribute more to chain weight.

topics.title: Longest Chain vs Entropic Rule Comparison
topics.summary: Demonstrates through examples how POEM's entropic rule provides better security against adversaries compared to longest chain rule. Shows that when honest miners produce simultaneous blocks, the entropic rule reduces adversarial advantage by preferring blocks with better hash values.

topics.title: Mathematical Framework and Probability Theory
topics.summary: Discusses the mathematical foundations of POEM analysis, including exponential distribution of block 'fatness', gamma distribution for chain work, and Poisson processes. Explains the challenge of connecting discrete hash values to continuous mathematical tools for analysis.

topics.title: POEM Composability and Future Applications
topics.summary: Explains POEM's key advantage of composability with other proof-of-work optimizations like Prism and parallel chains. Since POEM only changes the fork choice rule, it can be combined with other structural improvements to achieve cumulative performance gains while maintaining security.
